file_content.text: Sej has been spreading the word about what you did. Even Republic Command got wind of it. You're a hero.
I see you were successful. We're going to leak word that the Empire tried to sell Balmorrans as slaves and how the Republic rescued them.
Because of what you did, we may actually gain support. Thank you.
It was an honor to assist you.
We could do with more of that kind of help around here.
I have to admit--it was touch and go for a while.
Those Mandalorians were tough.
But you came through in the end. That's all that matters.
It's over.
I don't think the Imperials will bother hiring mercenaries anymore.
I have been... doubting the Republic. It seemed you were using us to satisfy grudges against the Empire.
But you have restored my faith in the Republic's motives. You didn't have to go in to the mercenary camp, but you did.
You saved my people, and for that, I thank you. Farewell.
Time is our enemy here. The longer you wait, the more chance the Balmorrans will be shipped offworld.
You lied to me, Alya. You promised to keep us safe! Where was your "protection" when we needed it?
I'm sorry, Sej. We lost some good people, too, but we'll fix this.
Right on time. I told you Command would come through--these people are responsible for disabling the Imperial satellite network. Your people are as good as rescued.
Right on time. I told you Command would come through--this group has done more to damage the Empire than anyone else. Your people are as good as rescued.
Master Jedi. You see? Command is taking this seriously. With a Jedi's help, your people will be rescued in no time.
Perfect timing, Captain. You see? Command is taking this seriously. They've sent Special Forces to rescue your people.
I told you Command would come through. This person has done more damage to the Empire than an entire army. Your people are as good as rescued.
Right on cue. You see? Command is taking this seriously. They've sent the person responsible for taking out the Imperial satellites to rescue your people.
Back up a second. Has someone been kidnapped?
Who needs rescuing?
Balmorran villagers. You didn't know? Then... you aren't from Republic Command.
Command didn't send me.
Really? Then fate must be smiling at us, because you're just who we need.
I have neither the time nor desire to hear your problems.
Let me be.
I have no idea what you're talking about.
Leave me alone.
Sorry, pal, it's my day off.
Don't bother me.
Please. You have to help--at least listen. Please.
I'm Alya Selray, Republic ambassador to the Balmorran people. It's my job to make sure civilians are kept safe during the war.
Safe? Republic Command doesn't supply enough soldiers to keep a child safe.
Sej is one of the local leaders. He stepped up after the others were wiped out--but what he says is true.
Republic soldiers were supposed to escort us to a safe zone. But Mandalorian mercenaries attacked--wiped your people out, killed half of my village and kidnapped the rest!
We need to get out there and bring your people back.
The villagers must be rescued.
That monster has probably sold them off by now.
What's the point in kidnapping villagers?
Why kidnap them?
Those mercenaries need to see what happens when you attack civilians.
The Mandalorians must pay.
Those Mandalorians need to see the business end of a blaster rifle.
The mercs need a lesson.
The mercenaries need to be shown what happens when you ally yourself with the dark side.
Time for punishment.
I agree; their boss thinks nothing can touch him.
The leader of the Mandalorians is Monta Drai. They work for the Empire, but Monta has a slave trade operating on the side.
He has gotten away with his crimes for too long.
I agree, but our main priority is getting those villagers back before they're shipped offworld. Taking Monta down would be a bonus.
Besides... if we fail in this, the Balmorrans may withdraw their support for the Republic.
Get the safe zone ready. I'll have those Balmorrans out in no time.
I'll get the villagers back.
Watch your back out there. The Mandalorians are better trained than the Empire's soldiers. They have snipers, shock troops, everything.
They've set up camp outside the city. That's where they'll be holding the prisoners. Good luck.
Sorry, but rescuing villagers isn't really my thing. I'm sure Command will send someone.
Not my job. [Refuse quest]
I really hope so. We don't have much time left.
Can't talk now. I've got a blaster wound to take care of.
I'll rescue the villagers and take care of Monta Drai. He'll see the consequences of accepting the Empire's money.
Rescue, check; kill, check.
Fine. But make sure you focus on the villagers, first.
If there's no one else.
